message.content:
Validate the ktlint setup added to this Gradle project.

## Files to validate

1. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/gradle/libs.versions.toml` — should have `ktlint = "1.8.0"` version and `ktlint-cli` library entry
2. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/ktlint.gradle` — Groovy DSL script with `repositories { mavenCentral() }`, `ktlint` configuration, `ktlintCheck` and `ktlintFormat` JavaExec tasks
3. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/build.gradle.kts` — should have `allprojects { apply(from = "$rootDir/ktlint.gradle") }`
4. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/.editorconfig` — should have `max-line-length = 120` for `*.{kt,kts}`

## Also validate source files had wildcard imports properly expanded:
5. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/backend/src/main/kotlin/com/bookreads/user/User.kt`
6. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/backend/src/main/kotlin/com/bookreads/session/ReadingSession.kt`
7. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/backend/src/main/kotlin/com/bookreads/user/UserController.kt`
8. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/backend/src/main/kotlin/com/bookreads/session/SessionController.kt`
9. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/backend/src/main/kotlin/com/bookreads/leaderboard/LeaderboardController.kt`

## Checks
- No wildcard imports remain (`import X.*` pattern)
- No unused imports were left behind after expansion
- `ktlint.gradle` tasks have correct mainClass (`com.pinterest.ktlint.Main`)
- `Bundling.EXTERNAL` attribute set for fat-jar resolution
- `jvmArgs "--add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED"` present on ktlintFormat task
- All explicit imports actually exist in the files' code (no phantom imports)

Report any issues found.

content.text: I'll read all the files in parallel to validate the ktlint setup.

    18→    @Id
    19→    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)

    21→    @ManyToOne(fetch = FetchType.LAZY, optional = false)

1→package com.bookreads.user
     2→
     3→import com.bookreads.dto.UserDto
     4→import org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity
     5→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ExceptionHandler
     6→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping
     7→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PathVariable
     8→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PostMapping
     9→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestBody
    10→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping
    11→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController
    12→
    13→@RestController
    14→@RequestMapping("/api/v1/users")
    15→class UserController(
    16→    private val userService: UserService,
    17→) {
    18→    data class CreateUserRequest(
    19→        val username: String,
    20→    )
    21→
    22→    @PostMapping
    23→    fun createOrGet(
    24→        @RequestBody request: CreateUserRequest,
    25→    ): ResponseEntity<UserDto> = ResponseEntity.ok(userService.getOrCreate(request.username))
    26→
    27→    @GetMapping("/{username}")
    28→    fun getUser(
    29→        @PathVariable username: String,
    30→    ): ResponseEntity<UserDto> = ResponseEntity.ok(userService.getByUsername(username))
    31→
    32→    @ExceptionHandler(IllegalArgumentException::class)
    33→    fun handleBadRequest(ex: IllegalArgumentException): ResponseEntity<Map<String, String>> =
    34→        ResponseEntity.badRequest().body(mapOf("error" to (ex.message ?: "Bad request")))
    35→
    36→    @ExceptionHandler(NoSuchElementException::class)
    37→    fun handleNotFound(ex: NoSuchElementException): ResponseEntity<Map<String, String>> =
    38→        ResponseEntity.notFound().build()
    39→}
    40→

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

1→package com.bookreads.session
     2→
     3→import com.bookreads.dto.SessionDto
     4→import org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity
     5→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ExceptionHandler
     6→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping
     7→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PathVariable
     8→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PostMapping
     9→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestBody
    10→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping
    11→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController
    12→
    13→@RestController
    14→@RequestMapping("/api/v1/sessions")
    15→class SessionController(
    16→    private val sessionService: SessionService,
    17→) {
    18→    data class StartSessionRequest(
    19→        val username: String,
    20→        val bookTitle: String,
    21→    )
    22→
    23→    data class EndSessionRequest(
    24→        val username: String,
    25→    )
    26→
    27→    @PostMapping("/start")
    28→    fun startSession(
    29→        @RequestBody request: StartSessionRequest,
    30→    ): ResponseEntity<SessionDto> = ResponseEntity.ok(sessionService.startSession(request.username, request.bookTitle))
    31→
    32→    @PostMapping("/end")
    33→    fun endSession(
    34→        @RequestBody request: EndSessionRequest,
    35→    ): ResponseEntity<SessionDto> = ResponseEntity.ok(sessionService.endSession(request.username))
    36→
    37→    @GetMapping("/active/{username}")
    38→    fun getActiveSession(
    39→        @PathVariable username: String,
    40→    ): ResponseEntity<SessionDto> {
    41→        val session = sessionService.getActiveSession(username)
    42→        return if (session != null) ResponseEntity.ok(session) else ResponseEntity.noContent().build()
    43→    }
    44→
    45→    @ExceptionHandler(NoSuchElementException::class)
    46→    fun handleNotFound(ex: NoSuchElementException): ResponseEntity<Map<String, String>> =
    47→        ResponseEntity.status(404).body(mapOf("error" to (ex.message ?: "Not found")))
    48→
    49→    @ExceptionHandler(IllegalStateException::class)
    50→    fun handleConflict(ex: IllegalStateException): ResponseEntity<Map<String, String>> =
    51→        ResponseEntity.status(409).body(mapOf("error" to (ex.message ?: "Conflict")))
    52→}
    53→

<system-reminder>

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

1→package com.bookreads.leaderboard
     2→
     3→import com.bookreads.dto.LeaderboardEntryDto
     4→import org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity
     5→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ExceptionHandler
     6→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping
     7→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping
     8→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestParam
     9→import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController
    10→
    11→@RestController
    12→@RequestMapping("/api/v1/leaderboard")
    13→class LeaderboardController(
    14→    private val leaderboardService: LeaderboardService,
    15→) {
    16→    @GetMapping
    17→    fun getLeaderboard(
    18→        @RequestParam(defaultValue = "alltime") window: String,
    19→    ): ResponseEntity<List<LeaderboardEntryDto>> = ResponseEntity.ok(leaderboardService.getLeaderboard(window))
    20→
    21→    @ExceptionHandler(IllegalArgumentException::class)
    22→    fun handleBadRequest(ex: IllegalArgumentException): ResponseEntity<Map<String, String>> =
    23→        ResponseEntity.badRequest().body(mapOf("error" to (ex.message ?: "Bad request")))
    24→}
    25→

content.text: Now I'll check for any remaining wildcard imports across the entire source tree as a final cross-check.

All data is gathered. Here is the full validation report.

---

## Validation Report — ktlint Setup

### 1. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/gradle/libs.versions.toml`

PASS.

- `ktlint = "1.8.0"` present at line 5.
- `ktlint-cli = { module = "com.pinterest.ktlint:ktlint-cli", version.ref = "ktlint" }` present at line 11.

---

### 2. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/ktlint.gradle`

PASS on all required checks.

- `repositories { mavenCentral() }` — present (lines 1-3).
- `configurations { ktlint }` — present (lines 5-7).
- `ktlintCheck` task registered as `JavaExec` with `mainClass = "com.pinterest.ktlint.Main"` — present (lines 17-23).
- `ktlintFormat` task registered as `JavaExec` with `mainClass = "com.pinterest.ktlint.Main"` — present (lines 25-32).
- `Bundling.EXTERNAL` attribute set via `getObjects().named(Bundling, Bundling.EXTERNAL)` — present (line 12).
- `jvmArgs "--add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED"` — present on `ktlintFormat` only (line 30), which matches the spec (only `ktlintFormat` requires it for the format-in-place JVM access).

**One minor observation:** `jvmArgs` is absent on `ktlintCheck`. This is intentional and correct — the `--add-opens` flag is only needed for the format task that modifies files. No issue.

---

### 3. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/build.gradle.kts`

PASS.

- `allprojects { apply(from = "$rootDir/ktlint.gradle") }` — present (lines 10-12).

---

### 4. `/Users/se/git/cc-experiments/.editorconfig`

PASS — with one naming note.

- `[*.{kt,kts}]` section present (line 1).
- `max_line_length = 120` present (line 2).

**Minor — naming convention:** The spec described the key as `max-line-length` (hyphen), but the file uses `max_line_length` (underscore). For `.editorconfig`, the standard key name is `max_line_length` with underscores, and ktlint recognises this form. The hyphen variant is not standard. The file is **correct**; the spec description used non-standard spelling. No defect in the file.

---

### 5-9. Source files — wildcard import expansion

**No wildcard imports remain** anywhere under `backend/src` (grep over all `.kt` files returned zero matches).

**Per-file import audit (all explicit imports verified as actually used):**

**`User.kt`** (lines 3-9) — PASS.
- `jakarta.persistence.Column` — used on `@Column` annotations.
- `jakarta.persistence.Entity` — used on `@Entity`.
- `jakarta.persistence.GeneratedValue` — used on `@GeneratedValue`.
- `jakarta.persistence.GenerationType` — used in `GenerationType.IDENTITY`.
- `jakarta.persistence.Id` — used on `@Id`.
- `jakarta.persistence.Table` — used on `@Table`.
- `java.time.Instant` — used for `Instant.now()` default value.

**`ReadingSession.kt`** (lines 3-13) — PASS.
- `com.bookreads.user.User` — used as type of `val user: User`.
- `jakarta.persistence.Column` — used on multiple `@Column` annotations.
- `jakarta.persistence.Entity` — used on `@Entity`.
- `jakarta.persistence.FetchType` — used in `FetchType.LAZY`.
- `jakarta.persistence.GeneratedValue` — used on `@GeneratedValue`.
- `jakarta.persistence.GenerationType` — used in `GenerationType.IDENTITY`.
- `jakarta.persistence.Id` — used on `@Id`.
- `jakarta.persistence.JoinColumn` — used on `@JoinColumn`.
- `jakarta.persistence.ManyToOne` — used on `@ManyToOne`.
- `jakarta.persistence.Table` — used on `@Table`.
- `java.time.Instant` — used for `Instant.now()` and `Instant?` type.

**`UserController.kt`** (lines 3-11) — PASS.
- `com.bookreads.dto.UserDto` — used as return type.
- `org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity` — used as return type.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ExceptionHandler` — used on `@ExceptionHandler`.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping` — used on `@GetMapping`.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PathVariable` — used on `@PathVariable`.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PostMapping` — used on `@PostMapping`.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestBody` — used on `@RequestBody`.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping` — used on `@RequestMapping`.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController` — used on `@RestController`.

**`SessionController.kt`** (lines 3-11) — PASS. Same Spring annotation imports all verified against their usage; `SessionDto` used as return type; `PathVariable`, `RequestBody`, `PostMapping`, `GetMapping` all appear in the handler methods.

**`LeaderboardController.kt`** (lines 3-9) — PASS.
- `com.bookreads.dto.LeaderboardEntryDto` — used as `List<LeaderboardEntryDto>` return type.
- `org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity` — used as return type.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ExceptionHandler` — used on `@ExceptionHandler`.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping` — used on `@GetMapping`.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping` — used on `@RequestMapping`.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestParam` — used on `@RequestParam`.
- `org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController` — used on `@RestController`.

---

## Summary

**PASS — no defects found.**

All required ktlint infrastructure is present and correctly wired. All wildcard imports have been fully expanded. Every explicit import in all five source files corresponds to an actual usage in the file. No phantom imports, no unused imports, no wildcard imports remain.
